quotes.text: Do not be afraid. Open wide the doors to Christ.
quotes.source: Saint John Paul II, Inauguration Homily (1978)

quotes.text: Faith and reason are like two wings on which the human spirit rises to the contemplation of truth.
quotes.source: Saint John Paul II, Fides et Ratio (1998)

quotes.text: The world promises you comfort, but you were not made for comfort. You were made for greatness.
quotes.source: Pope Benedict XVI, World Youth Day Vigil (2010)

quotes.text: Holiness does not make you less human, for it is an encounter between your weakness and the power of God's grace.
Holiness is nothing other than charity lived to the full.
Every Christian is a missionary to the extent that he has encountered the love of God in Christ Jesus.
The future starts today, not tomorrow.
quotes.source: Saint John Paul II, Address to the Young (1999)

quotes.text: Let us remember the past with gratitude, live the present with enthusiasm, and look forward to the future with confidence.
quotes.source: Saint John Paul II, Novo Millennio Ineunte (2001)

quotes.text: Let no soul fear to draw near to Me, even though its sins be as scarlet.
The greater the sinner, the greater the right he has to My mercy.
Jesus, I trust in You.
We are called to show mercy because mercy has first been shown to us.
Mercy is the very foundation of the Church's life.
Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
If a soul does not exercise mercy somehow or other, it will not obtain My mercy on the day of judgment.
Divine Mercy is the bridge that connects God and man, opening our hearts to the hope of being loved forever despite our sinfulness.
quotes.source: Pope Francis, Divine Mercy Sunday Homily (2016)

quotes.text: Never be afraid of loving the Blessed Virgin too much; you can never love her more than Jesus did.
In dangers, in doubts, in difficulties, think of Mary, call upon Mary.
If you ever feel distressed during your day, call upon Our Lady; just say this simple prayer: "Mary, Mother of Jesus, please be a mother to me now."
To Jesus through Mary; we go to her only to lead us to the Savior.
Hail, full of grace, the Lord is with you.
Blessed is she who believed that the Lord would fulfill the promises he made to her.
My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord, and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior.
Mary kept all these things, reflecting on them in her heart.
Pray, hope, and don't worry. Worry is useless. God is merciful and will hear your prayer.
The glory of God is man fully alive.
Love and do what you will.
Start by doing what is necessary; then do what is possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
God has made us for Himself, and our hearts are restless until they rest in Him.
My vocation is love.
Listen carefully, my child, to the master's instructions, and attend to them with the ear of your heart.
quotes.source: Saint Benedict of Nursia, Rule Prologue

quotes.text: Teach us to give and not to count the cost.
quotes.source: Saint Ignatius of Loyola, Prayer for Generosity

quotes.text: For I know the plans I have for you, says the Lord, plans for your welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
The Lord is my shepherd; there is nothing I shall want.
Do not fear, for I am with you; do not be afraid, for I am your God.
Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.
We know that all things work together for good for those who love God.
Do not worry about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God.
The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear?
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. Do not let your hearts be troubled, neither let them be afraid.
